Cvetka: Pred dnevi sem spet ostala brez denarja, imela sem en sam evro
Cvetka Talaber iz Murske Sobote, ki ji za hrano ostane zgolj 60 evrov na mesec, je želela pomagati dečku z Obale do nujno potrebnega zdravila.
04 Nov 2019, 16:46 by Oste Bakal



Cvetki Talaber invalidska pokojnina zadošča komaj za položnice. FOTO: Oste Bakal



Na koncertu za Krisa je nastopil tudi Tržaški partizanski pevski zbor Pinko Tomažič. FOTO: Jaka Ivančič


Zgodba Krisa iz Kopra, ki je kot redko kdo povezal vso Slovenijo, saj so dobri ljudje, posamezniki, organizacije, društva, podjetja in še mnogi zanj v rekordnem času zbrali več kot 3,800.000 evrov, je prinesla tudi nekaj nadvse čustvenih zgodb. Ena gotovo prihaja iz Murske Sobote.Upokojena 62-letna Cvetka Talaber je namreč geslo, da za Krisa šteje vsak evro, vzela dobesedno in je fantu poslala kovanec za en evro, ki ga je z lepilnim trakom prilepila na fotografijo, ki jo je sama posnela. Fotografija laboda s Soboškega jezera, ki v kljunu nosi kovanec, je dovolj zgovorna. Na hrbtni strani je Cvetka še pojasnila, kaj si misli o vsem skupaj in zakaj fantku ne more poslati več denarja.
Neprijazna država
»Jaz sem v ponedeljek napolnila 62 let, ti še dveh ne, a imava skupno to, da sta najini dušici bele barve. Če že niso meni zdravniki, ZZZS ali ljudje pomagali iz Amerike pripeljati potrebnega aparata, ti bom jaz pomagala, čeprav z enim samim evrom. Več nimam, saj od sobote nisem nič jedla (pisala je v sredo, op. p.), kajti moja invalidska pokojnina je zadosti le za položnice. Politika me raje pusti umreti od pomanjkanja. Ti si še premlad, da bi to razumel, a jaz ti bom prek misli pošiljala borbenega duha, da boš zmagovalec, jaz pa najsrečnejši človek. Ta labod je zate. Nesi ga s seboj, in ko ga pogledaš, se do ušes nasmej in dal ti bo moč. V mislih in srcu si z mano, čeprav se ne poznava,« je napisala Cvetka Talaber, ki jo v Murski Soboti in okolici pozna veliko ljudi.
60 evrov ji ostane, ko plača vse položnice.
Obiskali smo jo v večjem bloku, kjer živi sama. Na lastne oči smo se prepričali, kako težko živijo mnogi med nami, predvsem upokojenci, ki so več desetletij pošteno delali, zdaj pa jim pokojnine ne omogočajo dostojnega življenja. Jezna je na politike in prepričana, da bi lahko bila država bistveno prijaznejša do vseh. Zdi se ji, da številni uslužbenci po državnih ustanovah ne vidijo dlje od svojega nosu in ne naredijo dovolj za ljudi. Ne preseneča je, da veliko ljudi le s težavo shaja, da je vedno več otrok, ki jim moramo državljani namesto države pomagati pri zbiranju denarja za nujno potrebna zdravila, terapije ali operativne posege v tujini.
Za nakazilo ni imela dovolj
Tudi sama dobro ve, kako je, ko človek zboli, pa nima nikogar, ki bi mu priskočil na pomoč, država pa si pred njegovimi težavami zatiska oči. Zaposlena je bila 26 let, nato pa se je hudo poškodovala in je po večletnem zdravljenju, terapijah in bolniškem staležu postala invalidska upokojenka. Danes prejema natanko 489 evrov. Ko poravna vse obveznosti, ji za hrano ostane zgolj 60 evrov, o nakupu oblačila ali obutve, počitnicah ali sploh kakšnem priboljšku lahko le sanja. Po drugi strani vedno poskuša pomagati drugim, vsaj z minimalnim zneskom.Tudi če bom pet dni v tednu lačna, bom pomagala.»Pred dnevi sem spet ostala brez denarja, imela sem en sam evro. Šla sem na CSD Murska Sobota, kjer sem jih prosila za nekaj živilskih izdelkov in dejala, da bom zadnji evro namenila Krisu. Morala sem ga poslati v pismu, saj bi na pošti za nakaznico plačala dodatnega 1,5 evra, vendar tega denarja nisem imela. Bila sem na Soboškem jezeru, kjer mi se je približal labod, da sem ga lahko fotografirala. Tako sem imela lepo fotografijo za Krisa, ki sem ji priložila omenjeni evro. Labod prinaša srečo in Kris jo resnično potrebuje. Prepričana sem, da jo bo prinesel fantu. Srečna bom, ko bo Kris normalno zaživel brez vseh težav in zapletov,« nam pripoveduje Cvetka, ki se spominja, da je tudi sama imela podobno težavo. Njen sin se je namreč leta 2002 huje poškodoval na nogometni tekmi in bi potreboval približno milijon takratnih tolarjev, da bi lahko pozdravili njegovo zapestje. Tega denarja ni bilo in fant, ki je danes seveda že odrasel mož, se ni dokončno pozdravil, njegova nogometna kariera pa je splavala po Muri.
Zdaj je na vrsti Gal
Osemdesetodstotna invalidka Cvetka nam je zatrdila, da bo po svojih zmožnostih pomagala še naprej. Zdaj je na vrsti mali Gal iz okolice Maribora. Prav te dni je prodala zapestnico, ki jo je dobila, ko je praznovala abrahama. »Nekoč smo dobro živeli, ni bilo pomanjkanja, toda uničili in izčrpali sta me nesreča in poškodba, seveda tudi sinova. Najdražje je bilo drugo mnenje iz ZDA, a kaj ko potem nismo mogli nabaviti potrebnega aparata. Zaradi vsega tega sem zasovražila sistem, zato poskušam pomagati vsakomur, ki je pomoči potreben, zlasti otrokom, ne glede na barvo, raso, versko pripadnost ipd. Otroci morajo imeti prednost pred kapitalom in to mora biti vsakomur jasno. Tudi če bom pet dni v tednu lačna, bom pomagala,« pravi naša sogovornica.Danes se po njenem prepričanju v Sloveniji težko živi. »Žalosti me, da morajo ljudje v 21. stoletju zbirati sredstva za tako srčkane malčke, ko je njihovo življenje odvisno od enega samega zdravila ali medicinskega posega. Če bi Kris ali kateri koli drug otrok potreboval kateri moj organ, bi mu ga brez pomislekov odstopila,« še pove Sobočanka Cvetka Talaber, ki rada ljubiteljsko slika in fotografira. To jo veseli in tudi čas mineva hitreje in prijetneje.


Na koncertu za Krisa je nastopil tudi Tržaški partizanski pevski zbor Pinko Tomažič. FOTO: Jaka Ivančič

Koncert za KrisaV Osnovni šoli Koper so v ponedeljek pripravili glasbeni večer, ki je bil namenjen prvi veliki zmagi 19-mesečnega Krisa Zudicha iz Kopra in njegovim prijateljem, otrokom, ki kot on potrebujejo sredstva za nujno zdravljenje. Na odru so se združila velika imena slovenske glasbene scene in v triurnem koncertu pričarala večer, poln čustev in pozitivne energije. Zbrali so približno 8000 evrov. Zgodbo dečka, ki mu bo znesek namenjen, bodo v kratkem predstavili v društvu Palčica pomagalčica, ki mu bo tudi namenjen izkupiček koncerta. Nastopajoči, med katerimi so bili Jan Plestenjak, Nina Pušlar, Lea Sirk, Rudi Bučar, Challe Salle, Tržaški partizanski pevski zbor Pinko Tomažič, Manca Špik, Slavko Ivančić in Anika Horvat, so se seveda odpovedali honorarju.

Cvetka: I lost my money a few days ago, I had a single euro
The flower girl Talaber from Murska Sobota, who is left with only 60 euros a month for food, wanted to help the boy from the Coast to get the urgently needed medicine.
04 Nov 2019, 16:46 by Oste Bakal



Flowers Talaber disability pension is barely enough for money orders. PHOTO: Oste Bakal



The concert for Kris also featured the Trieste Partisan Choir Pinko Tomažič. PHOTO: Jaka Ivancic


The story of Kris from Koper, who rarely connected the whole of Slovenia, as good people, individuals, organizations, societies, companies and many others raised more than € 3,800,000 in record time, also brought some very emotional stories. One, surely, comes from Murska Sobota.The retired 62-year-old Cvetka Talaber had the motto that she counts every euro for Kris, took literally, and sent the boy a one euro coin, which she glued with a glue tape to a photo of herself. . The photo of a swan from Sobos Lake carrying a coin in its beak is eloquent enough. On the back, Cvetka went on to explain what she thought of the whole thing and why she couldn't send the boy any more money.
Hostile country
“I turned 62 on Monday, you two are not, but we have in common that our two souls are white. If doctors, health insurance companies, or people have not helped me bring the necessary apparatus from America, I will help you, even with a single euro. I no longer have, as I have not eaten since Saturday (she wrote on Wednesday, op. P.), Because my disability pension is sufficient only for money orders. Politics would rather let me die of scarcity. You are too young to understand, but I will send you through the mind a fighting spirit that you will be the victor and I will be the happiest man. This swan is for you. Take it with you, and when you look at it, smile to your ears and it will give you strength. You are with me in my mind and heart, even though we don't know each other, "wrote Cvetka Talaber, who is known by many people in Murska Sobota and its surroundings.
$ 60 is left to her when she pays all the bills.
We visited her in a larger block where she lives alone. With our own eyes, we have seen how hard many of us are living, especially retirees who have worked hard for decades, but now their pensions do not allow them a decent life. She is angry with politicians and is convinced that the country could be significantly friendlier to all. It seems to her that many staffers across state institutions do not see beyond their nose and do not do enough for people. Unsurprisingly, many people are just having a hard time realizing that there are more and more children that citizens, instead of the state, need to help raise money for urgently needed medicines, therapies, or surgeries abroad.
She didn't have enough to make a deposit
She knows all too well how when a person gets sick, she has no one to come to his aid, and the country is turning a blind eye to its problems. She was employed for 26 years and then seriously injured and became a disabled pensioner after years of treatment, therapy and sick leave. Today, he receives exactly $ 489. When she settles all her obligations, she only has $ 60 left for food, and she can only dream of buying clothes or footwear, vacations, or any kind of outfit. On the other hand, she always tries to help others, at least with a minimal amount. Even if I am hungry five days a week, I will help. "I lost money again a few days ago, I had a single euro. I went to CSD Murska Sobota, where I asked them for some food products and said that I would spend the last euro on Kris. I had to send it in a letter, as it would pay an extra $ 1.5 at the post office, but I didn't have that money. I was on Lake Sobos, where a swan approached me so I could photograph it. So I had a nice photo for Chris, which I attached the aforementioned euro. Swan brings good luck and Kris really needs it. I'm sure he'll bring it to the boy. I will be happy when Kris lives normally without all the hassle and complications, "Cvetka tells us, who remembers that she herself had a similar problem. In 2002, her son suffered a serious injury at a football game and would need about one million tolars to heal his wrist. That money was gone, and the boy, who is naturally an adult man today, did not say goodbye, and his football career was rafting on Mura.
Now it's Gal
Eighty-five percent of Cvetka's disabled woman assured us that she would continue to help in her abilities. Now it is the little Gal from the vicinity of Maribor. Just these days she sold the bracelet she got when she celebrated Abraham. “We used to live well, there was no shortage, but I was devastated and exhausted by the accident and the injury, of course my sons. The most expensive was the second opinion from the US, but then when we could not get the necessary apparatus. Because of all this, I hated the system, so I try to help anyone who needs help, especially children, regardless of color, race, religious affiliation, etc. Children must have priority over capital and this must be made clear to everyone. Even if I am hungry five days a week, I will help, "our interlocutor says. Today, according to her, it is difficult to live in Slovenia. “It saddens me that people in the 21st century need to raise funds for such cute toddlers when their lives depend on a single drug or medical intervention. If Kris or any other child needed any of my organs, I would have given it up without a second thought, ”said Sobotanka Cvetka Talaber, who loves to paint and photograph. This makes her happy and time passes faster and more pleasantly.


The concert for Kris also featured the Trieste Partisan Choir Pinko Tomažič. PHOTO: Jaka Ivancic

Concert for Kris At Koper Elementary School, a music evening was held on Monday to mark the first major victory of 19-month-old Kris Zudich from Koper and his friends, children who, like him, need emergency treatment. On stage, the big names of the Slovenian music scene came together and in a three-hour concert, they sparked an evening full of emotions and positive energy. They raised about $ 8,000. The story of the boy to whom the amount will be earmarked will shortly be presented at the Palcica Helper Society, who will also receive the proceeds of the concert. Performers, including Jan Plestenjak, Nina Pušlar, Lea Sirk, Rudi Bucar, Challe Salle, the Trieste Partisan Choir Pinko Tomažič, Manca Špik, Slavko Ivančić and Anika Horvat, of course waived the fee.
